subject: Clickable sounds of English and MP3 recording software
msgSnippet: REF: http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Read_Alphabet/post? act=reply&messageNum=159 The URL that you referenced is out of date but still works for me when I click
messageBody:
REF: http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Read_Alphabet/post?
act=reply&messageNum=159

The URL that you referenced is out of date but still works for me
when I click on it. I will update it.

The site with the clickable sound files is at
http://victorian.fortunecity.com/vangogh/555/Spell/saunds-eng.html
See if you can get to that one.

You can also search for "sounds" on the site specific Google search
engine at http://www.unifon.org

Give me a list of ten words you want pronounced in a midwestern
general American accent and I will send it to you as an MP3.

The location for the simple MP3 recording software is
http://www.talksender.com There are free versions for Mac and PC.
With this software installed, all you need is a microphone to start
recording and emailing your sound bites.

.MP3 files are about a tenth the size of .WAV files. The other
disadvantage of the .WAV format is that I do not know of any cheap
way to make them. Do you?

Regards,

Steve

--- In Read_Alphabet@y..., HeyMister57@a... wrote:
> Fantastic!
>
> First, of course MP3 files are easy, The links to
> "http://victorian.fortunecity.com/vangogh/555/Spell/" don't work.
> So we have a couple of ways to go from here. Either we can
> create ".wav" files for your site so you don't have to rely on
> anyone else, which fixes
> both of our problems, or we can simply exchange the recordings
